messages.content: ComfyUI_DDColor is an unofficial support for DDColor in ComfyUI, which allows users to use DDColor models within the ComfyUI interface.
What was the main change made in the revised version of ComfyUI-DDColor?
The main change made in the revised version of ComfyUI-DDColor was changing the model downloading directory to ComfyUI's official folders.
Where can the DDColor models be downloaded from?
The DDColor models can be automatically downloaded to the '/checkpoints' folder using Hugging Face Hub, or manually downloaded from https://huggingface.co/piddnad/DDColor-models/tree/main.
Where can I find information about the different DDColor models?
Information about the different DDColor models can be found at https://github.com/piddnad/DDColor/blob/master/MODEL_ZOO.md.
What are some working values to try for the model input size in ComfyUI_DDColor?
Some working values to try for the model input size in ComfyUI_DDColor are 256, 512, and 1024.
No, ComfyUI_DDColor is an unofficial support for DDColor in ComfyUI.
What is the original repository for ComfyUI-DDColor?
The original repository for ComfyUI-DDColor is https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-DDColor.
